results.title: Drug-Induced Complete Atrioventricular Block in an Elderly Patient: A Case Report Highlighting Digoxin-Beta Blocker Interactions and a Paradoxical State.
results.text_hl: Clinical examination revealed @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ and a holosystolic @DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@murmur@@@ in the mitral valve area, while the electrocardiogram showed complete @DISEASE_Atrioventricular_Block @DISEASE_MESH:D054537 @@@AV block@@@ at a ventricular rate of 35 bpm.

citations.NLM: Bustea C, Radu AF, Vesa CM, Radu A, Bodog TM, Bodog RF, Maghiar PB, Maghiar AM. Drug-Induced Complete Atrioventricular Block in an Elderly Patient: A Case Report Highlighting Digoxin-Beta Blocker Interactions and a Paradoxical State. Life (Basel). 2025 Jan 31;15(2):. PMID: 40003624
citations.BibTeX: @article{40003624, title={Drug-Induced Complete Atrioventricular Block in an Elderly Patient: A Case Report Highlighting Digoxin-Beta Blocker Interactions and a Paradoxical State.}, author={Bustea C and Radu AF and Vesa CM and Radu A and Bodog TM and Bodog RF and Maghiar PB and Maghiar AM}, journal={Life (Basel)}, volume={15}, number={2}}

results.title: Hypotension and bradycardia associated with concomitant tizanidine and lisinopril therapy.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@Hypotension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ associated with concomitant @CHEMICAL_tizanidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C023754 @@@tizanidine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ therapy.

citations.NLM: Publow SW, Branam DL. Hypotension and bradycardia associated with concomitant tizanidine and lisinopril therapy. Am J Health Syst Pharm. 2010 Oct 1;67(19):1606-10. PMID: 20852161
citations.BibTeX: @article{20852161, title={Hypotension and bradycardia associated with concomitant tizanidine and lisinopril therapy.}, author={Publow SW and Branam DL}, journal={Am J Health Syst Pharm}, volume={67}, number={19}, pages={1606-10}}

results.title: Short-term lisinopril treatment in old rats worsens impairment of angiotensin-induced reflex bradycardia.
results.text_hl: Short-term @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ treatment in old @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ worsens impairment of angiotensin-induced reflex @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@.

citations.NLM: Montemayor E, Mellick JR, Kerecsen L, Buñag RD. Short-term lisinopril treatment in old rats worsens impairment of angiotensin-induced reflex bradycardia. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1997 Oct;30(4):510-6. PMID: 9335412
citations.BibTeX: @article{9335412, title={Short-term lisinopril treatment in old rats worsens impairment of angiotensin-induced reflex bradycardia.}, author={Montemayor E and Mellick JR and Kerecsen L and Buñag RD}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={30}, number={4}, pages={510-6}}

results.title: Abated cardiovascular responses to chronic oral lisinopril treatment in conscious elderly rats.
results.text_hl: The stronger overall enhancement of pressor responsiveness and reflex @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ in younger @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ suggests that the cardiovascular effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ diminish with advancing age.

citations.NLM: Buñag R, Mellick J, Allen B. Abated cardiovascular responses to chronic oral lisinopril treatment in conscious elderly rats. Am J Physiol. 1999 May;276(5):R1408-15. PMID: 10233034
citations.BibTeX: @article{10233034, title={Abated cardiovascular responses to chronic oral lisinopril treatment in conscious elderly rats.}, author={Buñag R and Mellick J and Allen B}, journal={Am J Physiol}, volume={276}, number={5}, pages={R1408-15}}

results.title: Acute and chronic effects of the converting enzyme inhibitors enalapril and lisinopril on reflex control of heart rate in normotensive man.
results.text_hl: A similar effect was observed following @CHEMICAL_Edrophonium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004491 @@@edrophonium@@@. After @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ induced by facial immersion (diving reflex) was significantly attenuated.

citations.NLM: Ajayi AA, Campbell BC, Howie CA, Reid JL. Acute and chronic effects of the converting enzyme inhibitors enalapril and lisinopril on reflex control of heart rate in normotensive man. J Hypertens. 1985 Feb;3(1):47-53. PMID: 2987341
citations.BibTeX: @article{2987341, title={Acute and chronic effects of the converting enzyme inhibitors enalapril and lisinopril on reflex control of heart rate in normotensive man.}, author={Ajayi AA and Campbell BC and Howie CA and Reid JL}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={3}, number={1}, pages={47-53}}

results.title: Effects of chronic treatment with lisinopril on cardiovascular complications in streptozotocin diabetic and DOCA hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: Treatment of @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (1 mg kg-1, p.o. daily for six weeks), in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ and @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ animals prevented @CHEMICAL_Streptozocin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013311 @@@STZ@@@ induced @DISEASE_Body_Weight @DISEASE_MESH:D001835 @@@loss of body weight@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypothyroidism @DISEASE_MESH:D007037 @@@hypothyroidism@@@.

citations.NLM: Sevak AR, Goyal RK. Effects of chronic treatment with lisinopril on cardiovascular complications in streptozotocin diabetic and DOCA hypertensive rats. Pharmacol Res. 1996 Nov-Dec;34(5-6):201-9. PMID: 9076844
citations.BibTeX: @article{9076844, title={Effects of chronic treatment with lisinopril on cardiovascular complications in streptozotocin diabetic and DOCA hypertensive rats.}, author={Sevak AR and Goyal RK}, journal={Pharmacol Res}, volume={34}, number={5-6}, pages={201-9}}

results.title: Arginine vasopressin and baroreflex function after converting enzyme inhibition in normal humans.
results.text_hl: At modestly increased plasma levels, @GENE_AVP @GENE_551 @@@AVP@@@ did not affect the responses of HR, FVR, plasma NE, or systemic NE spillover to baroreflex deactivation and activation. After @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, @GENE_AVP @GENE_551 @@@AVP@@@ infusion produced a modest @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ but still had no significant positive effect on either response.

citations.NLM: Goldsmith SR. Arginine vasopressin and baroreflex function after converting enzyme inhibition in normal humans. Am J Physiol. 1997 Mar;272(3 Pt 1):E429-36. PMID: 9124549
citations.BibTeX: @article{9124549, title={Arginine vasopressin and baroreflex function after converting enzyme inhibition in normal humans.}, author={Goldsmith SR}, journal={Am J Physiol}, volume={272}, number={3 Pt 1}, pages={E429-36}}

results.title: Placebo effect and efficacy of nebivolol in patients with hypertension not controlled with lisinopril or losartan: a phase IV, randomized, placebo-controlled trial.
results.text_hl: A subanalysis suggests that the effect on DBP may be stronger in @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@-treated than @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Weiss RJ, Stapff M, Lin Y. Placebo effect and efficacy of nebivolol in patients with hypertension not controlled with lisinopril or losartan: a phase IV, randomized, placebo-controlled trial. Am J Cardiovasc Drugs. 2013 Apr;13(2):129-40. PMID: 23519546
citations.BibTeX: @article{23519546, title={Placebo effect and efficacy of nebivolol in patients with hypertension not controlled with lisinopril or losartan: a phase IV, randomized, placebo-controlled trial.}, author={Weiss RJ and Stapff M and Lin Y}, journal={Am J Cardiovasc Drugs}, volume={13}, number={2}, pages={129-40}}
